noun.description: A formal written request, typically one signed by many people, appealing to authority with respect to a particular cause.
examples: she was asked to sign a petition against plans to build on the local playing fields

verb.description: Make or present a formal request to (an authority) with respect to a particular cause.
examples: Americans who moved west petitioned Congress for admission to the Union as states
leaders petitioned the government to hold free elections soon

origin: Middle English: from Latin petitio(n-), from petit- aimed at, sought, laid claim to, from the verb petere.
